bibl.title: Letter from Landon C. Bell to Henry Rose Carter, December 18, 1916

div1.p: Bell sends Carter a subpoena to appear as a witness for the Colleton Cypress Co.

div1.head: Letter from Landon C. Bell to Henry Rose Carter, December 18, 1916
div1.opener:
THE COLLETON CYPRESS COMPANY
MANUFACTURERS OF
CYPRESS AND PINE LUMBER
LATH AND SHINGLES
GENERAL OFFICES: COLUMBUS, OHIO
SPECIALTIES
WIDE CLEAR
CYPRESS
CYPRESS MOULDINGS
AND FINISH
MILLS, COLLETON, S. C.
EASTERN SALES OFFICE
238 LAND TITLE BLDG.
PHILADELPHIA, PA.
No.
DEC 22 1916.A.M.
Bureau of the
Public Health Service.
Columbus, Ohio, Dec. 18th, 1916.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
Marine, Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I am just back from South Carolina where I have
conferred with my associates in regard to the mosquito cases,
and among other things we considered was the question of the
attendance of our witnesses,- particularly the witnesses who
are non-residents of the State of South Carolina. The cases
will stand for trial at the Common Pleas Court, which begins
on the 4th Monday in March next, and of course it may be, and
probably will be, that the cases will not actually be begun
on that date, but at some later date during that term. How-
ever, we will have to be ready so far as we know now on that
date.

We do not desire to take depositions of witnesses
unless it is going to be impossible to have the witnesses per-
sonally present. It may be, however, that we will have to
take depositions as a matter of precaution, although we expect
and hope to have the witnesses personally present also.

I herewith enclose you a subpoena writ summoning you
to appear as a witness on behalf of The Colleton Cypress Company
ALL ORDERS AND CONTRACTS ARE TAKEN SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE HOME OFFICE, AND ARE CONDITIONAL UPON STRIKES, FIRE, FLOODS, INABILITY TO
SECURE CARS, AND OTHER CAUSES BEYOND OUR CONTROL. ALL QUOTATIONS ARE SUBJECT TO PRIOR SALE.
H.R.C.- 2.
at the Court beginning on the 4th Monday in March next, and also
hand you herewith a subpoena. On the back of the subpoena
writ is a place for acceptance of service and I will thank you
to date that acceptance and sign your name and return to me and
oblige. The subpoena herewith sent you is to be retained
by you as your authority for appearing as a witness.

Please advise me if you expect to be able to personally
attend the Court on the 4th Monday in March next, and if not is
there any possibility that you will be outside of the United States?
I ask this question because if we have your acceptance of service
as a witness and you are ill or for any other unavoidable reason
not in attendance upon the Court, we would have pretty good grounds
for continuing the cases until some time when you could attend,-
that is if you were at the time in the United States. Such would
not be the case if you were outside of the jurisdiction of the
United States.

I enclose self-addressed envelope for the return of
the subpoena writ.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Landon C Belly
General Counsel. LCB/WFS
Enc.
cc/H.R. & Y.
P. & M.
